questions.question_text: Which activity requires access to Cisco DNA Center CLI?

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure an ERSPAN tunnel that mirrors traffic from Linux1 on Switch1 to Linux2 on Switch2. Which command must be added to the destination configuration to enable the ERSPAN tunnel?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Given answer is correct.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
The ERSPAN ID is required to match on both the source and destination devices of the ERSPAN tunnel
https://youtu.be/RHXbeyYvRp0
ID needs to be the same
I think this question is wrong. The destination address is pointing to sw2 loop back when itâ€™s suppose to be the Linux box. Shutdown is not configured either.

comments.content: origin address is the source of the GRE tunnel used to encapsulate traffic in ERSPAN, and yeah you're right the no shut command needs to be configured to start the monitoring session. see https://networklessons.com/cisco/ccie-routing-switching-written/erspan. So I think your right this question is a little off.
